Name: The automatic waiver of certain additional penalties for a parking violation if a vehicle owner responds to a notice of violation between forty-five and ninety days of its issuance
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the automatic waiver of certain additional penalties for a parking violation if a vehicle owner responds to a notice of violation between forty-five and ninety days of its issuance

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Summary: This bill would provide for the automatic waiver of certain additional penalties for failure to respond to a parking violation if the owner of a vehicle responds to such violation between 45 and 90 days after its issuance.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Section 19-211 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 33 for the year 1993, is amended by adding a new subdivision c to read as follows:
      c. If an owner makes a plea or appears between forty-five and ninety days after the issuance of a notice of violation for a parking violation, any additional penalty for failure to respond to a notice of violation for a parking violation within forty-five days and any additional penalty for failure to respond to a notice of violation for a parking violation within seventy-five days, as described in subdivision a, shall be waived. 
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.
